description: Children should go to school and learn
title: I learn!
content:
Every child has both the right and the obligation to attend school—or receive an education at home as permitted and assessed by local/state authorities—up to the age set by applicable state and local law.  

Regardless of who they are, ***all*** children should be encouraged to continue their studies through college and beyond.

Children should be able to learn all subjects matters required and/or permitted by federal, state, and local laws, whether they are in public or private schools, or are being schooled at home. Regardless of who they are or where they are learning, ***all*** children have the right to a quality education that supports their intellectual, imaginative, moral, and psychosocial growth. School is vital as a preparation for adult life, and should, among other things, teach children how to get along with others, be and caring and respectful towards other people and towards the environment, be resilient, resourceful, and imaginative, and be well-prepared to pursue happiness in their adult lives.

Children have the right to know what is important for their welfare. Radio, television, books, newspapers, computers, etc. help them to grow up and educate themselves. Adults should make sure that the information they receive is positive and help them to find and understand whatever information they need to grow, learn, explore, imagine, and care about others and the environment.
